Package us.daveread.edu.graphics.shape

Class VisibleObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.daveread.edu.graphics.shape.VisibleObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Circle, Ellipse, Image, LineSegment, Rectangle, Text
    public abstract class VisibleObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements Drawable
    Represents a visible object that can be drawn on a DrawingSurface.
    Author:
    readda
    See Also:
    DrawingSurface

    • Field Detail

      • LOG

        private static final org.apache.log4j.Logger LOG
        Setup the logger for the class.

      • myDrawingSurface

        private DrawingSurface myDrawingSurface
        The drawing surface that this object is placed on.

      • location

        private java.awt.Point location
        Typically the upper left-hand pixel location for the drawable. Subclasses are free to modify the use of this. For example line segments would use this as a starting location and text output would use it to inform the baseline location.

      • rotationDegrees

        private int rotationDegrees
        The number of degrees clockwise (with 0 being unrotated) that the drawable should be rotated when drawn

      • borderColor

        private java.awt.Color borderColor
        The border color for the drawable. Subclasses are free to use this as appropriate but typically it should be used for the outline of a shape.

      • fillColor

        private java.awt.Color fillColor
        The fill color for the drawable. Subclasses are free to use this as appropriate but typically it should be used for the fill of a shape or background of an image.

      • clickable

        private boolean clickable
        Whether mouse clicks on this object are to be detected. This setting defaults to true.

      • opacity

        private float opacity
        The opacity of the object. 1.0 is fully opaque (visible).

    • Constructor Detail

      • VisibleObject

        protected VisibleObject​(java.awt.Point location,
                        int rotationDegrees,
                        java.awt.Color borderColor,
                        java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Create a visible object with its left-hand X and Y pixel locations, rotation, border and fill colors as provided. Subclasses may interpret these values as appropriate for their circumstances. The object will be clickable and fully opaque.
        Parameters:
        location - The upper left-hand pixel location
        rotationDegrees - The rotation in degrees (clockwise) for drawing the object
        borderColor - The border color of the object
        fillColor - The fill color of the object
        See Also:
        setClickable(boolean), setOpacity(float)

    • Method Detail

      • setDrawingSurface

        public void setDrawingSurface​(DrawingSurface myDrawingSurface)
        Description copied from interface: Drawable
        Set the drawing surface which contains this Drawable
        Specified by:
        setDrawingSurface in interface Drawable
        Parameters:
        myDrawingSurface - The drawing surface that this Drawable is on

      • stateChanged

        protected void stateChanged()
        Used to tell the drawing surface that this object has changed its appearance in some way. This will typically cause the object to be redrawn.

      • getLocation

        public final java.awt.Point getLocation()
        Get the upper left-hand pixel location.
        Returns:
        The upper left-hand pixel location

      • setLocation

        public final void setLocation​(java.awt.Point location)
        Set the upper left-hand pixel location.
        Parameters:

        See Also:
        setX(int), setY(int)

      • setX

        public final void setX​(int x)
        Sets the X pixel location. This is equivalent to using the setLocation method passing a Point with the new X and current Y values
        Parameters:
        x - The new X pixel location
        See Also:
        setLocation(Point)

      • setY

        public final void setY​(int y)
        Sets the Y pixel location. This is equivalent to using the setLocation method passing a Point with the current X and new Y values
        Parameters:
        y - The new Y pixel location
        See Also:
        setLocation(Point)

      • getRotationDegrees

        public final int getRotationDegrees()
        Get the rotation degrees (clockwise) for this object. 0 indicates no rotation.
        Returns:
        The rotation degrees

      • setRotationDegrees

        public final void setRotationDegrees​(int rotationDegrees)
        Set the rotation degrees (clockwise) for this object. 0 indicates no rotation. The value must be in the range of 0 to 359. Values outside of the range will be set to absoluteValue(rotationDegrees) % 360.
        Parameters:
        rotationDegrees - The rotation degrees

      • getBorderColor

        public final java.awt.Color getBorderColor()
        Get the border color.
        Returns:
        The border color

      • setBorderColor

        Set the border color.
        Parameters:
        borderColor - The border color

      • getFillColor

        public final java.awt.Color getFillColor()
        Get the fill color.
        Returns:
        The fill color

      • setFillColor

        public final void setFillColor​(java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Set the fill color.
        Parameters:
        fillColor - The fill color

      • setOpacity

        public final void setOpacity​(float opacity)
        Set the opacity of the object when drawn. A value of 1.0 is fully opaque (visible) while 0.0 is fully transparent (invisible). This does not affect whether the object responds to click events.
        Parameters:
        opacity - The opacity of the object in the range 1.0 (fully opaque) to 0.0 (fully transparent)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the parameter is outside the range of 0.0 to 1.0
        See Also:
        setClickable(boolean)

      • getOpacity

        public final float getOpacity()
        Get the opacity of the object. The value ranges from 1.0 (opaque) to 0.0 (transparent)
        Returns:
        The opacity value

      • mouseClickDetected

        public boolean mouseClickDetected​(int x,
                                  int y)
        Default implementation only matches the location pixel. Subclasses should override this to detect a click within their area.
        Specified by:
        mouseClickDetected in interface Drawable
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the mouse click
        y - The Y coordinate of the mouse click
        Returns:
        True if the X, Y coordinate lies within the Drawable's area
        See Also:
        Drawable.isClickable()

      • setClickable

        public void setClickable​(boolean isClickable)
        Set whether this object should be clickable. If true the underlying implementation's calculation for detecting a click within its area will be used and the DrawingSurface notified of the click.

        This value defaults to true unless the underlying object overrides this behavior.

        Parameters:
        isClickable - True if the object should be clickable

      • isClickable

        public boolean isClickable()
        Description copied from interface: Drawable
        Detect whether the Drawable is clickable. If true the underlying implementation's logic for determining a click occurred will be used. Otherwise clicks on the Drawable will be ignored.
        Specified by:
        isClickable in interface Drawable
        Returns:
        True if clicking the Drawable is to be detected
        See Also:
        Drawable.mouseClickDetected(int, int), DrawingSurface.drawableMouseClick(Drawable)

      • getLastGraphicsContext

        protected final java.awt.Graphics2D getLastGraphicsContext()
        Allows subclasses to use the graphics context (NOT FOR DRAWING) but for things like calculating font metrics
        Returns:
        The latest graphics context used by the underlying drawing surface

      • drawMe

        public final void drawMe​(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Draw the graphic on the supplied graphics context. This method uses the two callback methods to hand off drawing responsibility to the subclass.

        Note that the fill is drawn first and the border second in order to assure the border covers any fill that encroaches on the border area.

        Specified by:
        drawMe in interface Drawable
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics context
        See Also:
        drawBorder(Graphics2D), fillContent(Graphics2D)

      • drawBorder

        public abstract void drawBorder​(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Subclasses must implement this method to handle drawing the border. Note that the color will already have been set on the graphic context.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics context for drawing

      • fillContent

        public abstract void fillContent​(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Subclasses must implement this method to handle filling the shape. Note that the drawing color will already have been set on the graphics context.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics context for drawing

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
